conclusion: Need to analyze the displacement of each car from t = 0 s to t = 10 s.
Displacement of a car can be calculated as the area under its velocity-time (v-t) graph over the given time interval.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s starting from t = 0 s.
Car B starts from rest (v = 0) and accelerates linearly, reaching v = 40 m/s at t = 20 s.
Displacement of Car A is the area of a rectangle under the graph from t = 0 s to t = 10 s.
Displacement of Car A = Area of rectangle = 40 x 10 = 400 m.
Displacement of Car B is the area of a triangle under the graph from t = 0 s to t = 10 s.
Displacement of Car B = Area of triangle = 1/2 x base x height = 1/2 x 10 x 20 = 100 m.
At t = 10 s, Car A has traveled 400 m, while Car B has traveled 100 m.
Car A is ahead of Car B at t = 10 s.
